edu.umd.cs.psl.model.atom

Class AtomEventFramework

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umd.cs.psl.model.atom.AtomEventFramework
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AtomManager

    public class AtomEventFramework
extends java.lang.Object
implements AtomManager
    AtomManager with support for AtomEvents.

    An AtomEventFramework handles two types of events: consideration and activation.

    A RandomVariableAtom is considered when it is instantiated in memory and added to its Database's AtomCache via getAtom(Predicate, GroundTerm...). Warning: if a RandomVariableAtom is instantiated in memory other than via a call to getAtom(Predicate, GroundTerm...), then no consideration event will be generated during the life of the Database.

    A RandomVariableAtom is activated if it has not already been activated since being instantiated in memory and one of two things occur:

    1. checkToActivate() is called and its truth value is at or above a threshold
    2. activateAtom(RandomVariableAtom) is called on that Atom

    AtomEvent.Listener implementations can register to be notified of these events.

    For each event, an AtomEvent is added to the job queue. Calling workOffJobQueue() will cause the appropriate Listeners to be notified of events in the queue until the queue is empty. Before any Listeners are notified, all activated RandomVariableAtoms in the queue will be committed to the Database.

      • checkToActivate

        public int checkToActivate()
        Adds a AtomEvent#ActivatedRVAtom event to the job queue for each RandomVariableAtom in the Database's AtomCache which is at or above the activation threshold and has not already been activated by this AtomEventFramework since being loaded into memory.
        Returns:
        number of Atoms activated
        See Also:
        workOffJobQueue()

      • activateAtom

        public void activateAtom(RandomVariableAtom atom)
        Adds a AtomEvent#ActivatedRVAtom event to the job queue for a RandomVariableAtom, regardless of its truth value.

        No event will be generated if the Atom has already been activated by this AtomEventFramework since being loaded into memory.

        Parameters:
        atom - Atom to activate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if atom does not belong to this framework's Database
        See Also:
        workOffJobQueue()

      • workOffJobQueue

        public void workOffJobQueue()
        Processes all pending AtomJobs.

        This method should be called after considering or activating Atoms so that listeners will be notified.
